controls.title: Running worker process as non-privileged user
controls.desc: The NGINX worker processes should run as non-privileged user. In case of compromise of the process, an attacker has full access to the system.

descriptions.label: default
descriptions.data: The NGINX worker processes should run as non-privileged user. In case of compromise of the process, an attacker has full access to the system.

controls.code:
control 'nginx-01' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Running worker process as non-privileged user'
  desc 'The NGINX worker processes should run as non-privileged user. In case of compromise of the process, an attacker has full access to the system.'
  describe user(nginx_lib.valid_users) do
    it { should exist }
  end
  describe parse_config_file(nginx_conf, options) do
    its('user') { should eq nginx_lib.valid_users }
  end

  describe parse_config_file(nginx_conf, options) do
    its('group') { should_not eq 'root' }
  end
end

results.code_desc: User www-data is expected to exist
results.resource_params: ["www-data"]

results.code_desc: Parse Config File /etc/nginx/nginx.conf user is expected to eq "www-data"
results.resource_params: ["/etc/nginx/nginx.conf", {:assignment_regex=>/^\s*([^:]*?)\s*\ \s*(.*?)\s*;$/}]

results.code_desc: Parse Config File /etc/nginx/nginx.conf group is expected not to eq "root"
results.resource_params: ["/etc/nginx/nginx.conf", {:assignment_regex=>/^\s*([^:]*?)\s*\ \s*(.*?)\s*;$/}]

controls.title: Check NGINX config file owner, group and permissions.
controls.desc: The NGINX config file should owned by root, only be writable by owner and not write- and readable by others.

descriptions.label: default
descriptions.data: The NGINX config file should owned by root, only be writable by owner and not write- and readable by others.

results.code_desc: File /etc/nginx/nginx.conf is expected to be owned by "root"
results.resource_params: ["/etc/nginx/nginx.conf"]

results.code_desc: File /etc/nginx/nginx.conf is expected to be grouped into "root"
results.resource_params: ["/etc/nginx/nginx.conf"]

results.code_desc: File /etc/nginx/nginx.conf is expected not to be readable by others
results.message: expected File /etc/nginx/nginx.conf not to be readable by others
results.resource_params: ["/etc/nginx/nginx.conf"]

results.code_desc: File /etc/nginx/nginx.conf is expected not to be writable by others
results.resource_params: ["/etc/nginx/nginx.conf"]

results.code_desc: File /etc/nginx/nginx.conf is expected not to be executable by others
results.resource_params: ["/etc/nginx/nginx.conf"]

controls.title: Nginx default files
controls.desc: Remove the default nginx config files.

descriptions.label: default
descriptions.data: Remove the default nginx config files.

controls.code:
control 'nginx-03' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Nginx default files'
  desc 'Remove the default nginx config files.'
  describe file(File.join(nginx_confd, 'default.conf')) do
    it { should_not be_file }
  end

  describe file(File.join(nginx_enabled, 'default')) do
    it { should_not be_file }
  end
end

results.code_desc: File /etc/nginx/conf.d/default.conf is expected not to be file
results.message: expected `File /etc/nginx/conf.d/default.conf.file?` to be falsey, got true
results.resource_params: ["/etc/nginx/conf.d/default.conf"]

results.code_desc: File /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/default is expected not to be file
results.resource_params: ["/etc/nginx/sites-enabled/default"]

controls.title: Check for multiple instances
controls.desc: Different instances of the nginx webserver should run in separate environments

descriptions.label: default
descriptions.data: Different instances of the nginx webserver should run in separate environments

controls.code:
control 'nginx-04' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Check for multiple instances'
  desc 'Different instances of the nginx webserver should run in separate environments'
  describe command('ps aux | egrep "nginx: master" | egrep -v "grep" | wc -l') do
    its(:stdout) { should match(/^1$/) }
  end
end

results.code_desc: Command: `ps aux | egrep "nginx: master" | egrep -v "grep" | wc -l` stdout is expected to match /^1$/
results.resource_params: ["ps aux | egrep \"nginx: master\" | egrep -v \"grep\" | wc -l"]

controls.title: Disable server_tokens directive
controls.desc: Disables emitting nginx version in error messages and in the “Server” response header field.

descriptions.label: default
descriptions.data: Disables emitting nginx version in error messages and in the “Server” response header field.

controls.code:
control 'nginx-05' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Disable server_tokens directive'
  desc 'Disables emitting nginx version in error messages and in the “Server” response header field.'
  describe parse_config(nginx_parsed_config, options) do
    its('server_tokens') { should eq 'off' }
  end
end

results.code_desc: Parse Config  server_tokens is expected to eq "off"

controls.title: Prevent buffer overflow attacks
controls.desc: Buffer overflow attacks are made possible by writing data to a buffer and exceeding that buffer boundary and overwriting memory fragments of a process. To prevent this in nginx we can set buffer size limitations for all clients.

descriptions.label: default
descriptions.data: Buffer overflow attacks are made possible by writing data to a buffer and exceeding that buffer boundary and overwriting memory fragments of a process. To prevent this in nginx we can set buffer size limitations for all clients.

controls.code:
control 'nginx-06' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Prevent buffer overflow attacks'
  desc 'Buffer overflow attacks are made possible by writing data to a buffer and exceeding that buffer boundary and overwriting memory fragments of a process. To prevent this in nginx we can set buffer size limitations for all clients.'
  describe parse_config(nginx_parsed_config, options) do
    its('client_body_buffer_size') { should eq CLIENT_BODY_BUFFER_SIZE }
  end
  describe parse_config(nginx_parsed_config, options) do
    its('client_max_body_size') { should eq CLIENT_MAX_BODY_SIZE }
  end
  describe parse_config(nginx_parsed_config, options) do
    its('client_header_buffer_size') { should eq CLIENT_HEADER_BUFFER_SIZE }
  end
  describe parse_config(nginx_parsed_config, options) do
    its('large_client_header_buffers') { should eq LARGE_CLIENT_HEADER_BUFFER }
  end
end

results.code_desc: Parse Config  client_body_buffer_size is expected to eq "1k"
Parse Config  client_max_body_size is expected to eq "1k"
Parse Config  client_header_buffer_size is expected to eq "1k"
Parse Config  large_client_header_buffers is expected to eq "2 1k"

controls.title: Control simultaneous connections
controls.desc: NginxHttpLimitZone module to limit the number of simultaneous connections for the assigned session or as a special case, from one IP address.

descriptions.label: default
descriptions.data: NginxHttpLimitZone module to limit the number of simultaneous connections for the assigned session or as a special case, from one IP address.

controls.code:
control 'nginx-07' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Control simultaneous connections'
  desc 'NginxHttpLimitZone module to limit the number of simultaneous connections for the assigned session or as a special case, from one IP address.'
  describe parse_config(nginx_parsed_config, options) do
    its('limit_conn_zone') { should eq '$binary_remote_addr zone=default:10m' }
  end
  describe parse_config(nginx_parsed_config, options) do
    its('limit_conn') { should eq 'default 5' }
  end
end

results.code_desc: Parse Config  limit_conn_zone is expected to eq "$binary_remote_addr zone=default:10m"
Parse Config  limit_conn is expected to eq "default 5"

controls.title: Prevent clickjacking
controls.desc: Do not allow the browser to render the page inside an frame or iframe.

descriptions.label: default
descriptions.data: Do not allow the browser to render the page inside an frame or iframe.

controls.code:
control 'nginx-08' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Prevent clickjacking'
  desc 'Do not allow the browser to render the page inside an frame or iframe.'
  describe parse_config(nginx_parsed_config, options_add_header) do
    its('add_header') { should include 'X-Frame-Options SAMEORIGIN' }
  end
end

results.code_desc: Parse Config  add_header is expected to include "X-Frame-Options SAMEORIGIN"
results.message: expected nil to include "X-Frame-Options SAMEORIGIN", but it does not respond to `include?`

controls.title: Enable Cross-site scripting filter
controls.desc: This header is used to configure the built in reflective XSS protection. This tells the browser to block the response if it detects an attack rather than sanitising the script.

descriptions.label: default
descriptions.data: This header is used to configure the built in reflective XSS protection. This tells the browser to block the response if it detects an attack rather than sanitising the script.

controls.code:
control 'nginx-09' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Enable Cross-site scripting filter'
  desc 'This header is used to configure the built in reflective XSS protection. This tells the browser to block the response if it detects an attack rather than sanitising the script.'
  describe parse_config(nginx_parsed_config, options_add_header) do
    its('add_header') { should include 'X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"' }
  end
end

results.code_desc: Parse Config  add_header is expected to include "X-XSS-Protection \"1; mode=block\""
results.message: expected nil to include "X-XSS-Protection \"1; mode=block\"", but it does not respond to `include?`

controls.title: Disable content-type sniffing
controls.desc: It prevents browser from trying to mime-sniff the content-type of a response away from the one being declared by the server. It reduces exposure to drive-by downloads and the risks of user uploaded content that, with clever naming, could be treated as a different content-type, like an executable.

descriptions.label: default
descriptions.data: It prevents browser from trying to mime-sniff the content-type of a response away from the one being declared by the server. It reduces exposure to drive-by downloads and the risks of user uploaded content that, with clever naming, could be treated as a different content-type, like an executable.

controls.code:
control 'nginx-10' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Disable content-type sniffing'
  desc 'It prevents browser from trying to mime-sniff the content-type of a response away from the one being declared by the server. It reduces exposure to drive-by downloads and the risks of user uploaded content that, with clever naming, could be treated as a different content-type, like an executable.'
  describe parse_config(nginx_parsed_config, options_add_header) do
    its('add_header') { should include 'X-Content-Type-Options nosniff' }
  end
end

results.code_desc: Parse Config  add_header is expected to include "X-Content-Type-Options nosniff"
results.message: expected nil to include "X-Content-Type-Options nosniff", but it does not respond to `include?`

controls.title: TLS Protocols
controls.desc: When choosing a cipher during an SSLv3 or TLSv1 handshake, normally the client's preference is used. If this directive is enabled, the server's preference will be used instead.

descriptions.label: default
descriptions.data: When choosing a cipher during an SSLv3 or TLSv1 handshake, normally the client's preference is used. If this directive is enabled, the server's preference will be used instead.

results.code_desc: Parse Config  ssl_protocols is expected to be in "TLSv1.3", "TLSv1.2", "TLSv1.2 TLSv1.3", and "TLSv1.3 TLSv1.2"
results.message: expected `` to be in the list: `["TLSv1.3", "TLSv1.2", "TLSv1.2 TLSv1.3", "TLSv1.3 TLSv1.2"]`

results.code_desc: Parse Config  ssl_session_tickets is expected to eq "off"

Parse Config  ssl_ciphers is expected to eq "'ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:ECDHE-ECDSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305:ECDHE-RSA-C...CDHE-ECDSA-AES256-SHA384:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-SHA256:ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA256'"
Parse Config  ssl_prefer_server_ciphers is expected to eq "on"
Parse Config  ssl_dhparam is expected to eq "/etc/nginx/dh4096.pem"

controls.title: Add HSTS Header
controls.desc: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) is a web security policy mechanism which helps to protect websites against protocol downgrade attacks and cookie hijacking. It allows web servers to declare that web browsers (or other complying user agents) should only interact with it using secure HTTPS connections, and never via the insecure HTTP protocol. HSTS is an IETF standards track protocol and is specified in RFC 6797.

descriptions.label: default
descriptions.data: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) is a web security policy mechanism which helps to protect websites against protocol downgrade attacks and cookie hijacking. It allows web servers to declare that web browsers (or other complying user agents) should only interact with it using secure HTTPS connections, and never via the insecure HTTP protocol. HSTS is an IETF standards track protocol and is specified in RFC 6797.

controls.code:
control 'nginx-13' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Add HSTS Header'
  desc 'HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) is a web security policy mechanism which helps to protect websites against protocol downgrade attacks and cookie hijacking. It allows web servers to declare that web browsers (or other complying user agents) should only interact with it using secure HTTPS connections, and never via the insecure HTTP protocol. HSTS is an IETF standards track protocol and is specified in RFC 6797.'
  describe parse_config(nginx_parsed_config, options_add_header) do
    its('add_header') { should include 'Strict-Transport-Security max-age=15768000' }
  end
end

results.code_desc: Parse Config  add_header is expected to include "Strict-Transport-Security max-age=15768000"
results.message: expected nil to include "Strict-Transport-Security max-age=15768000", but it does not respond to `include?`

controls.title: Disable insecure HTTP-methods
controls.desc: Disable insecure HTTP-methods and allow only necessary methods.

descriptions.label: default
descriptions.data: Disable insecure HTTP-methods and allow only necessary methods.

controls.code:
control 'nginx-14' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Disable insecure HTTP-methods'
  desc 'Disable insecure HTTP-methods and allow only necessary methods.'
  ref 'OWASP HTTP Methods', url: 'https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Test_HTTP_Methods_(OTG-CONFIG-006)'

  only_if { HTTP_METHODS_CHECK != false }
  describe file(nginx_conf) do
    its('content') { should match(/^\s*if\s+\(\$request_method\s+!~\s+\^\(#{HTTP_METHODS}\)\$\)\{?$/) }
  end
end

results.code_desc: No-op
results.skip_message: Skipped control due to only_if condition.

controls.title: Content-Security-Policy
controls.desc: The Content-Security-Policy HTTP response header helps you reduce XSS risks on modern browsers by declaring what dynamic resources are allowed to load via a HTTP Header

descriptions.label: default
descriptions.data: The Content-Security-Policy HTTP response header helps you reduce XSS risks on modern browsers by declaring what dynamic resources are allowed to load via a HTTP Header

controls.code:
control 'nginx-15' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Content-Security-Policy'
  desc 'The Content-Security-Policy HTTP response header helps you reduce XSS risks on modern browsers by declaring what dynamic resources are allowed to load via a HTTP Header'
  describe parse_config(nginx_parsed_config, options_add_header) do
    its('add_header') { should include 'Content-Security-Policy "script-src \'self\'; object-src \'self\'"' }
  end
end

results.code_desc: Parse Config  add_header is expected to include "Content-Security-Policy \"script-src 'self'; object-src 'self'\""
results.message: expected nil to include "Content-Security-Policy \"script-src 'self'; object-src 'self'\"", but it does not respond to `include?`

controls.title: Set cookie with HttpOnly and Secure flag
controls.desc: You can mitigate most of the common Cross Site Scripting attack using HttpOnly and Secure flag in a cookie. Without having HttpOnly and Secure, it is possible to steal or manipulate web application session and cookies and it’s dangerous.

descriptions.label: default
descriptions.data: You can mitigate most of the common Cross Site Scripting attack using HttpOnly and Secure flag in a cookie. Without having HttpOnly and Secure, it is possible to steal or manipulate web application session and cookies and it’s dangerous.

controls.code:
control 'nginx-16' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Set cookie with HttpOnly and Secure flag'
  desc 'You can mitigate most of the common Cross Site Scripting attack using HttpOnly and Secure flag in a cookie. Without having HttpOnly and Secure, it is possible to steal or manipulate web application session and cookies and it’s dangerous.'
  only_if { NGINX_COOKIE_FLAG_MODULE != false }
  describe parse_config(nginx_parsed_config, options_add_header) do
    its('set_cookie_flag') { should include '* HttpOnly secure' }
  end
end

results.code_desc: No-op
results.skip_message: Skipped control due to only_if condition.

controls.title: Control timeouts to improve performance
controls.desc: Control timeouts to improve server performance and cut clients.

descriptions.label: default
descriptions.data: Control timeouts to improve server performance and cut clients.

controls.code:
control 'nginx-17' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Control timeouts to improve performance'
  desc 'Control timeouts to improve server performance and cut clients.'
  describe parse_config(nginx_parsed_config, options) do
    its('keepalive_timeout') { should eq KEEPALIVE_TIMEOUT }
  end
  describe parse_config(nginx_parsed_config, options) do
    its('client_body_timeout') { should eq CLIENT_BODY_TIMEOUT }
  end
  describe parse_config(nginx_parsed_config, options) do
    its('client_header_timeout') { should eq CLIENT_HEADER_TIMEOUT }
  end
  describe parse_config(nginx_parsed_config, options) do
    its('send_timeout') { should eq SEND_TIMEOUT }
  end
end

results.code_desc: Parse Config  keepalive_timeout is expected to eq "5 5"
Parse Config  client_body_timeout is expected to eq "10"
Parse Config  client_header_timeout is expected to eq "10"
Parse Config  send_timeout is expected to eq "10"
